duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage and maintain all corporate owned assets within the territory, including trucks, forklifts, and containers.
Handle daily routing and performance metrics for associates, communicate any scheduling/operational delays to sales and serve center.
Manage compliance with DOT, OSHA, and local zoning regulations, as well as internal company policies.
Oversee financial management, including petty cash, refueling equipment, and monthly parts inventory reconciliation.
Provide hands-on training, coaching, and support to associates, and lead efforts to develop internal talent.
Manage customer experience to meet or exceed company goals, ensuring customer satisfaction and adherence to brand standards.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma required; college degree preferred or a minimum of 1 year of prior management experience.
Ability to apply and successfully attain CDL Class B License or higher.
Mechanical ability required to identify problems with equipment.
